headline.main: Riveted by War and Grief, Italy Mourns Slain Writer

lead_paragraph: Maria Grazia Cutuli, one of the four journalists killed in Afghanistan on Monday, is to have a school named after her in Rome. There will also be a Maria Grazia Cutuli center for immigrants here in her hometown and a Maria Grazia Cutuli newsroom at a journalism school in Milan. President Carlo Azeglio Ciampi said her death ''fills my soul with an overwhelmingly deep grief.'' The editor of her newspaper, Corriere della Sera, called her ''Italy's first casualty in this war,'' the war against terrorism, which the government was eager to join from the first.
abstract: Maria Grazia Cutuli, one of four journalists killed in Afghanistan, is deeply mourned in Italy by thousands of people who never knew her; photos; map (M)
